main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a single unidentified object in the sky over Burlington, Massachusetts on June 19, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for 10 minutes.
The object did not disappear, the observer simply lost sight of it.
The object was initially thought to be the star Capella, but the report concludes it was an unidentified aerial phenomenon.
The observer provided a hand-drawn sketch of the elongated, streamlined object.
The observer stated that no one else was with them at the time of the sighting.
